newsitem.title: CHINA: FORECAST-China '97 fixed asset investment seen up.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-China '97 fixed asset investment seen up.

text.p: China's fixed asset investment was expected to grow to 2.775 trillion yuan ($334.3 billion) in 1997, up by 17.6 percent from 2.36 trillion yuan in 1996, the Economic Information Daily said on Thursday.

Expansion of foreign and local investment in 1997 would put huge pressure on fixed-asset investment controls, the newspaper quoted Zhang Hanya, deputy director of the Investment Institute of the State Planning Commission as saying.
China was expected to attract $44 billion in foreign investment in 1997, Zhang said.
The foreign investment would require 730 billion yuan in domestic auxiliary capital in 1997, with such matching funds accounting for 25 percent of total fixed asset investment, he said.
Zhang said the central government would restructure the economy to curb blind investment that concentrated funds in a few high profile industries.
Investment would be diverted into China's key infrastructure and pillar industries, he said but did not elaborate.
Zhang also called for legislation to strengthen the management of investment, but gave no details of what kind of law was required.
